page.title: 16A DAY AT SCHOOL IN BRAILES
page.content: Brailes Church of England School is a small school of eighty seven pupils. On Tuesdays the vicar comes to lead morning assembly and then he teaches Religious Education to the Upper Junior class.From 10.35am.to 10.55am. we have playtime. After play the headmaster takes us for mathematics and computer work until dinner time. Most of us have sandwiches but about thirty_five children eat school meals. After our dinner hour we have history _ a follow up from a radio programme of the day before called 'History Not So Long Ago' For about three quarters of an hour after play we do sewing or craft.When we have cleared up we say our prayers and go home at three thirty.
